Kevin Durant praises his mother Wanda's proactive role in nurturing his passion Discuss Now Kevin Durant and his mother (Image Credit: Imagn) Phoenix Suns superstar forward Kevin Durant has long commended his mother, Wanda Durant, for her profound impact on his basketball career. However, according to the 14-time All-Star, she is also responsible for kickstarting his passion for playing video games.
In a clip from the "Up & Adams Show with Kay Adams" uploaded to X/Twitter on Wednesday, Durant answered a few Christmas-themed questions. When asked about the "best Christmas present (he's) ever gotten," the 2014 MVP didn't hesitate to recount his mother buying him his first video game console.
"A Sega Genesis," Durant said. â€¢

"It was so generous of my mom to buy that at that age," Durant said. "I was so bored in the house just watching TV reruns, and then she bought me a game. I was locked in, man. It just opened me up to the gaming world, and I've been hooked ever since. So, shoutout to my mom, she was just being proactive." Durant added that he initially played "Sonic" and "Mortal Kombat," referring to the games as "classics."
